intro: Gomesa dasytyle, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically range in color from pink to red. The plant has palmate leaves with a hairy texture, and it thrives in high-altitude environments. It is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to cool, temperate climates. Gomesa dasytyle is valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in cooler regions.
